summary: Basketball was created in 1891 by James Naismith, a Canadian physical education teacher, at a YMCA school in Springfield, Massachusetts. He designed it as a safer alternative to football, especially during winter. Naismith, then 31, wanted an indoor sport to keep athletes active. Basketball gained popularity quickly and spread from America to the world. It first became popular in colleges, then professionally, with the NBA forming in 1946. By the 20th century's end, the sport had become a significant part of American culture and a huge financial success.
title: History of basketball
